material.mattext: The alternative hypothesis in this case is:
The mean IQ level of people who were reared by their biological parents is higher than the mean of those who were not.
The mean IQ level of people who were reared by their biological parents is lower than the mean of those who were not.
There is no difference in mean IQ level between people who were reared by their natural parents and those who those who were not.
There is a difference in mean IQ level between people who were reared by their natural parents and those who those who were not.

Incorrect. While it is true that this claim could be an alternative hypothesis, it is not the alternative hypothesis in this case. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.

Incorrect. While it is true that this claim could be an alternative hypothesis, it is not the alternative hypothesis in this case. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.
Incorrect. The claim you chose is the null hypothesis. The alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. Read the problem description carefully and try again.
Good Job! Indeed, the alternative hypothesis represents what we suspect or want to check. In this case the study wants to check whether there are differences in mean IQ level between the two groups.
